Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2009 05:19PM TerryO wrote: Hello Everyone. Just a quick note. First thank you all for the thoughts and prayers. Please continue. Cathy was in sx for about 3 1/2 hours. The surgeon sd he thought he got it all so we are optimistic. There will be a follow up CT in a couple of weeks and spot on rads. Gamma as needed. As of about 2 hrs after sx Cathy was in ICU, awake, talking, eating ice chips. Does not appear to be deficit to speech, coordination or motor function as best as can be assesse from the bed. She is on pain meds of course, her head is wrapped in a delightful bandage, and she is asking about dinner. Well maybe tomorrow for the last one. I will keep everyone posted as information develops. Dr. sd she might go to reg room tomorrow and may go home Sun or Mon. Thank you everyone again....TerryO
Posts.Title: Prayers for TerryO's Cathy dreamwriter carol1949

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2009 08:53AM TerryO wrote: I just wanted to say hello to everyone and thank you for all your prayers and sedosa i am sorry i ruined your trip that you planned for us.  i was really, we were really looking forward to it.  thanks to all.  cathy

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2009 06:56PM TerryO wrote: Today was radiation day, the gamma knife. The MRI that was done this morning is said to be clear. The radiation thus is precautionary, just to make sure nothing microscopic was missed. We had to be here at 6 a.m. It is now almost 2 pm and they just took her back for tx. They put a halo thing on her head this morning, with four screws (ouch). Continuing to be optimistic. Appreciate all the prayers.  TerryO

Thanks again for the ongoing prayers and well wishes.  Terryo

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2009 08:24PM TerryO wrote: Update 7/23/09. Got results of follow up MRI this morning. Clear....no swelling, no sign of mass, no bleeding....nothing. Yeah. No news yet on Jack.

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2009 12:31PM TerryO wrote: Hello all. Another update, Sun. 7/5/09. Cathy came home from the hospital this morning. She appears to be doing well, talking, eating, walking, etc. Dr. is somewhat amazed that she is having little to no issues with coordination or other things. Had a follow up CT 4 a.m. Saturday morning, Dr. said it looked fine. Please continue to keep her in your thoughts and prayers. I cannot tell you how comforting it was for us both to read the posts, and get the phone calls, text messages, flowers, etc. You are some wonderful people! Take Care.  TerryO

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2011 05:27PM TerryO wrote: It is my understanding that tumor markers are not at all conclusive. I am aware of an incident of reoccur when tumor markers were at 26. I am told that less than 30 is the goal to shoot for, but in short yes, a reoccur when tumor markers went from 12 to 26.
